tier_1_determinative.sexual_act_description: The accused committed rape upon the child victim in a room in his house.
tier_1_determinative.absence_of_consent: The act falls under clause 6 of absence of consent as the victim was a minor, aged about 9 years.

tier_2_material.aggravated_circumstances_of_rape: The rape was followed by murder, as the accused strangled and killed the child victim after committing the sexual assault.
tier_2_material.relationship_to_accused: The child victim was a friend of the daughter of the accused.

tier_3_contextual.incident_location: The incident occurred in the house of the accused, located on the side of the panchayat road at Ponnamkallu in Amarambalam Village.
tier_3_contextual.incident_date_time: The incident occurred on 4th April, 2012, at around 6:45 am.
tier_3_contextual.time_of_reporting: The incident was reported on 4th April, 2012, at 7:00 pm. The delay was because the child victim went missing and a search was conducted before reporting.

tier_4_procedural.case_title: Abdul Nassar v. State of Kerala & Anr.

residual_details.additional_facts: The accused attempted to conceal the body of the victim beneath a cot and later in the bathroom. He also attempted to dispose of the body in a septic tank. The investigation included forensic evidence such as DNA matching, which linked the accused to the crime. The accused was sentenced to death for murder under Section 302 IPC and to 7 years of rigorous imprisonment for rape under Section 376 IPC. The conviction was based on circumstantial evidence, and the case was appealed to the Supreme Court after the High Court confirmed the death sentence.
